skill.name: web-artifacts-builder
skill.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies (React, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.
skill.summary: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern fronten...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with no security concerns. Shell scripts perform standard npm/pnpm package installations and file operations without external network calls or malicious patterns.

content.value_statement: Build sophisticated, interactive HTML artifacts for claude.ai using React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and 40+ pre-installed shadcn/ui components, all bundled into a single shareable HTML file.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + TypeScript projects with Vite
Pre-configure Tailwind CSS with shadcn/ui theming
Include 40+ shadcn/ui components (buttons, dialogs, forms, carousels, etc.)
Set up path aliases (@/) for clean imports
Bundle entire React app into single HTML file with Parcel
Auto-detect Node version and ensure compatibility (Node 18+)
Include all Radix UI dependencies for component library
limitations: Only for complex artifacts - overkill for simple single-file HTML/JSX
Requires Node.js 18+ and pnpm package manager
Generated artifacts may be large due to bundled dependencies
Not suitable for server-side rendering or backend logic
Bundling process adds development time overhead
Requires shadcn-components.tar.gz file in scripts directory

prompt_templates.prompt: Create an artifact showcasing all available shadcn/ui components (buttons, dialogs, tooltips, etc.) with examples and code snippets.

output_examples.input: Create a task management app artifact with drag-and-drop, categories, and due dates
output_examples.output: A single bundle.html file containing a fully functional React app with shadcn/ui components for task cards, dialogs for editing, calendar picker for dates, and drag-and-drop functionality - all self-contained and ready to share

best_practices: Use this skill only for complex artifacts that justify the React/bundling overhead
Avoid 'AI slop' design patterns: excessive centering, purple gradients, uniform rounded corners, Inter font
Import components using path aliases: import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
Leverage the pre-installed 40+ shadcn/ui components instead of building custom ones
Test the bundled artifact locally (open bundle.html in browser) before sharing
Use the dark mode system via next-themes for professional appearance
Keep bundle sizes reasonable by only importing needed components
anti_patterns: Using this skill for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts that don't need React
Testing/visualizing artifacts upfront - adds latency, test only if requested or issues arise
Ignoring Node version compatibility (script handles it, but be aware of requirements)
Creating generic-looking UIs with centered layouts and purple gradients
Forgetting to run bundle-artifact.sh before sharing (React dev files won't work as artifacts)

faq.question: When should I use this skill vs regular HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: Use this skill for complex artifacts needing state management, routing, multiple components, or shadcn/ui. For simple static pages or single-component demos, use regular HTML/JSX artifacts instead.

faq.question: What components are included?
faq.answer: 40+ shadcn/ui components including accordion, alert, avatar, badge, button, calendar, card, carousel, checkbox, dialog, dropdown-menu, form, input, label, navigation-menu, popover, progress, scroll-area, select, sheet, slider, switch, table, tabs, textarea, toast, tooltip, and more.

faq.question: Do I need to install shadcn/ui components manually?
faq.answer: No, the init-artifact.sh script pre-installs all 40+ components and their dependencies. Just import and use them directly.

faq.question: What's the difference between init-artifact.sh and bundle-artifact.sh?
faq.answer: init-artifact.sh creates the initial React project with all dependencies. bundle-artifact.sh is run after development to combine everything into a single HTML file for sharing.

faq.question: Can I use this with Node 16 or lower?
faq.answer: No, Node 18+ is required. The script auto-detects your Node version and configures Vite compatibility accordingly.

faq.question: How large are the bundled artifacts?
faq.answer: Bundle sizes vary based on components used, but expect several hundred KB to 1-2MB for full-featured apps due to React, Radix UI, and component libraries being inlined.
